definition: to be pleased beyond one's expectations (idiom)/overjoyed at the turn of events
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
outside/in addition/foreign/external

sentences.english: She was thrilled to be appreciated by strangers for the first time in her life.
sentences.chinese: 生平第一次有陌生人欣賞自己，她有些喜出望外。

sentences.english: I scrambled outof the reeds and walked towards the princess.
sentences.chinese: 我喜出望外，向公主走去。

sentences.english: Her daughters were eagerly called to partake of her joy.
sentences.chinese: 她喜出望外，急急忙忙喚女兒們來分享她這種愉快。

sentences.english: You will overwhelm my grandfather with delight if you play whist.
sentences.chinese: 您會打惠斯特就更使外祖父喜出望外了。

sentences.english: I was overjoyed so that I forgot the appointment.
sentences.chinese: 我喜出望外以致於忘記了約定。

sentences.english: Belinda was overjoyed to hear from you after so long.
sentences.chinese: 隔了這麼久才收到你的信，貝琳達喜出望外。

sentences.english: Mother talks to wear the beautiful glass shoe to Cinderella , Prince is delighted with one's unexpected good fortune.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽講到灰姑娘穿上美麗的玻璃鞋，王子喜出望外。

sentences.english: She said they had been "more than surprised" by the global interest.
sentences.chinese: 她說，故居引發全球競購令他們“喜出望外”。

sentences.english: I was overjoyed that I had gained a few pounds since last week!
sentences.chinese: 我爲我一週以來又長了幾磅體重而喜出望外。

sentences.english: I'll give Renaud a fine welcome.
sentences.chinese: 我一定給雷諾一個喜出望外的歡迎。

definition: overjoyed at unexpected good news (idiom)
to be wild with joy (idiom)
unable to contain one's joy (idiom)
unable to contain one's joy (idiom)
exultation
face light up with delight (idiom); to beam with joy
pleasantly surprised like mad (idiom); capering madly with joy/to express boundless pleasure
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
to burst with joy (idiom)/to be over the moon/to be elated
to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
happy
overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to shed tears of gratitude (idiom); moved to tears
ecstasy/rapt
